page.title: 03CHILD'S GUIDE TO DAVIOT.
page.content: {The River Nairn}is quite deep.People swim in the summer in the river.The river sometimes floods and then people can't swim.There are 102 steps down to the river.There are two paths to the river,one is over the A9 and the other is on other side of the valley.People go to the little burn just up the road from the river.It has a little waterfall in it which you can slide down into the water below.There is a {public park}by the{Daviot Primary {School.}It has a climbingframe,two swings ,a slide ,a sea-saw and a bench to sit on. It is quite big park and very well looked after.There is a litter bin just outside the fence of the park.The grass is cut every-so-often by the people of Highland Region.
